commitResults.messageBody:
- Gave chatbot a new name
- Implement an initial skeletal version that greets and exits

- refactored code
- Added io & chatengine packages
- Added IOHandler interface and ConsoleIO class
- Added ChatEngine class

- added ability to store texts by user
- users can retrieve list of text inputs stored

- added option to mark and unmark tasks
- added Task class to store task info
- added TaskList class to store list of tasks

- added support for tracking ToDos, Events & Deadlines
- changed Task to abstract class
- Added test cases for testing of basic event adding and querying

- refactored code to allow for better error handling
- added three types of exceptions common for chadbot: invalid commands, arguments, and format

The task manager does not offer delete task functionality.

Users might want to delete tasks they have completed already or for any other reason.

Let's remove tasks stored in the taskList class and offer the user commands to delete tasks by their index shown to the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor ChatEngine command handling and use enums
commitResults.messageBody:
Hardcoding of commands may lead to more problems in the future.

Handling all command logic in processInput is not maintainable.

Lets use enums for the commands that Chad can accept for improved Readability and Type Safety.

By abstracting out the logic for handling each of the commands into separate functions, commandHandler will now only need to be concerned with deciding which handler function to choose, leading to better separation of concerns.

Users couldn't save their list of tasks

Let's allow them to save their current tasks and retrieve it when they load the app again.
added data time parsing and storage for deadlines and event start and end.
Add more classes to follow OOP paradigmn
Added packages
Configured and added junit test cases
added javadocs for all non-public methods/classes
allow users to find tasks by keyword
fixed indentation for switch statements
fixed bugs

This commit includes two main changes:

1. Update unit tests for the `handleEvent` method in the ChatEngine class.
   - Tests now check for the expected output string when a valid event is added.
   - This ensures that the handler method is working as expected and producing the correct output.

2. Modify the `build.gradle` file to set the new entry point for the application.
   - The `mainClass` attribute in the `application` block has been updated to point to the new GUI launcher class.
   - This change is necessary due to the implementation of the new GUI.

These changes collectively improve the robustness of the application and prepare it for the new GUI implementation.
This commit introduces assert statements in the Parser.java and Storage.java classes to enforce important assumptions and improve code robustness.
Add assert statements
Removed redundant messages and renamed response variable to responseToUser for better clarity
Improve ChatEngine class code quality

Current TaskList class stores tasks but lacks a feature to sort them
by their deadlines or event dates.

Sorting tasks by date is useful for users who want to see their tasks
in order of urgency without having to manually reorder them.

Implement a method getSortedTasksByDate to sort tasks by their
deadlines and event dates. The method returns a new TaskList
containing the sorted tasks.

We create a sorted copy of the original task list
and encapsulate it in a new TaskList object to avoid modifying the
original list.

This design choice allows us to present a sorted view to the
user while keeping the underlying data unchanged.

Refer to the Java Collections.sort method documentation for
details on how sorting is implemented.
Updated readme to serve as a user guide and added representative ui image to docs folder
